title: Are humans too dependent on technology? Why or why not? - Quora

response.answer_text: What do you mean by “too dependent”? Be precise. We are dependent on technology. That's a fact. There are seven billion of us on the planet, and without technology, we’d max out at perhaps three. So unless you want to choose four billion people to kill, there's little point to complaining about it. Technology is what makes us successful as a species. Few people complain about the technology that brings food to our tables or makes our waste magically go away so we don't have to live in caves carved from mountains of our own filth. Usually, those who fret about “too much technology” are basically just saying “things aren't how they used to be and I don't like that,” which is what such people have been saying since bronze axes were the latest in bleeding-edge innovation. We rely on technology. Your life depends just as much on technology to support it as if you lived in a nuclear-powered submarine. That's not a bad thing; that technology allows you a longer, better, healthier life. Why would that be a problem?

This is what humans do. It is our defining trait. Tool making was technology, cooking is technology. There is no such thing as too dependent.Even the most primitive tribes have weapons and hunt. If electricity disappeared we would adjust to whatever technologies exist from pickling to lighting a fire with a bunch of twigs and a stick. Now some technologies allow for easier lives than others. Some enable longer life spans. But humans do the best they can do. Have an opinion write an essay Submissions

Well, they are designed to make our lives better, faster and easier so why would we not be dependent on them? There is the hard way, and the smart way. So people use technology to save time which they can spend doing things they love with people they love. If you are on the river washing clothes for a few hours while your neighbor presses one button on the washer and then goes to spend time reading a book, who is in a better situation? So yeah we are dependent because they are great!

With our useless claws, weak jaws, and naked skin? No. We are tool-inventors, tool-users, and we live and die by how well we have adapted to the environment by creating ever better tools. In fact: Tools made it possible for us to spread all over the globe, and the better tools we are creating today connect us together all across the globe, making it possible for us to interact and gain knowledge and cooperate so that we can make decisions about our planet's environment and not succumb to the Tragedy of the Commons of CO2 pollution. Tools actually make us smarter: Can Our Digital Tools Make Us Smarter? (Kindle Single) eBook: Howard Rheingold: Amazon.co.uk: Kindle Store We need good tools, we need better tools,we need information, we need to connect, we need dreams, in order not only to survive as a species,  but also to nurture the future.

This is a pickle picker:  Because it’s such a hassle to use a fork… Seriously? A pickle picker?! What on earth have we come to as a species, if we need to invent a fucking tool designed specifically to get pickles out of a fucking jar?? Fuck me.

What do you mean by “technology”? Fire is technology. Clothes are technology. Doing things by hand is crippling hard labour. If we had to plough the fields by hand, we could not support one hundredth of the population we do now. It used to be that 95% of the population worked in the fields by hand, as you seem to want, scratching a bare subsistence and dying early. You are doing the traditional Luddite thing of decrying the inventions of the last twenty or so year and harking back to a golden age that never existed.

I really believe we are too dependent on technology. Nowadays, many companies are also developing technology for seniors that will provide new ways for the elderly to get information, enhance communication, and monitor their health condition. I found a great article that covers the subject: How Technology Is Improving The Later Stages Of Life

Very much so. I am a server at a steakhouse. Parents allow their children to use their iPads and iPhones the whole time just so they can have a peaceful dinner. It's pretty hard to watch. I'm 34 and didn't grow up with this technology but am a big fan at the same time. It is what it is.

Oh yes I can, but for the sake of my time and yours, I will only tell one. My friend and I were stuck in a snow ditch, and her phone had gotten frozen, so it was unable to make a call. Friend- “Hey, can I use your phone to call my mom a sec? Me- “Yeah sure, what’s her number?” Friend- “…” Me- “Do you know her number?” Friend- “I had it in my phone” Me- Face palm So yes, people, remember phone numbers, don’t just put them into your phone and forget about them.

> Are we not able to do things by hand anymore? No, because if you want to abandon technology, you’ll need to go all the way back to the discovery of fire and first stone tool.  We survived solely because of technologies we made. No real reason to stop using them now.
